intro: Oziroe leuchlora, commonly known as the white-flowered oziroe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in woodland and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Oziroe leuchlora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
